title: Accenture delivers 58 hires for $297M ICE contract
summary: CBP awarded Accenture $297M contract to hire 7,500 border agents/officers to meet Trump's executive order. Delivered only 2 agents first year, 22-58 total hires by termination. $40K per hire cost exceeded average officer salary. Contract terminated April 2019 'for convenience' after DHS IG management alert.

sources.title: CBP terminates controversial $297 million Accenture contract amid continued staffing struggles
Trump Administration Cancels Contract That Failed to Bring on More Border Agents
CBP ends Accenture hiring contract 'for convenience'

notes: Contract awarded Nov 2017 to meet Trump executive order for 7500 additional CBP agents. By Oct 2018 - $13.6M paid for 2 accepted offers. By Dec 2018 - 22 hires on payroll, 58 applicants processed. Total $21M paid, $19M for startup costs. DHS IG 'management alert' stated 'Accenture has already taken longer to deploy and delivered less capability than promised'. Accenture charged ~$40K per hire vs average officer annual salary. Terminated 'for convenience' April 2019.
